question: Which country's research station is "Martin-de-Vivies"?
explanation: Martin-de-Vivies, also known as La Roche Godon, is a research station and the only settlement on Saint Paul and Amsterdam Islands of the French Southern and Antarctic Lands, an overseas territory of France, located in the Indian Ocean. The former name of this research station was "Camp Heurtin". This research station is a participant in the "Global Atmosphere Watch"
